title: Use a fixed pixel budget for rendering
message:
Use a fixed pixel budget for rendering

I chose 262144 pixels per RS invocation. This should go in far
less than 1 second per invocation and prevent Android restarting
phone because GPU appears to be stuck.

title: Get rid of other bitmap
message:
Get rid of other bitmap

Tried to directly create allocations and use the allocations API
to extract pixel data but that went to hell

title: Some additional hacks:
message:
Some additional hacks:

- request render when screen turns on to workaround the delay on the first
  frame render due to reloading the textures in case they have changed

- be more optimistic about the distance to the mandelbox set when estimating
  surface normal. This should significantly increase surface detail available
  for lighting calculations.

- give up on trying to stabilize distance to the set; just take the last
  half-step at iteration's end normally. It seems to be better to get reliably
  close to the set than to attempt to use unreliable estimates to generate a
  fixed distance to the set. The gradual change in the maximum distance metric
  results in pixel-sized jumps when viewing holes on surface at an angle, though.
  The only fix I can think of is to get closer than necessary to the set in order
  to step back reliably.

- need to improve performance. My Android phone becomes unusable when RS is running,
  and sometimes phone even reboots abruptly. I think it's probably because the RS
  hogs the GPU, where accelerable. I could try rendering the world in smaller
  chunks maybe, to give Android more opportunities to interact with the GPU. This
  RS shit is still half-baked, and it doesn't even help that I'm using a forEach
  loop as I'm supposed to.

message:

Update the distance estimator to walk back more precisely

title: Remove finish etc. in a vain hope to avoid crash
message:
Remove finish etc. in a vain hope to avoid crash

KK keeps on killing the mandelbox render because the RS object
GC takes too long to finalize an object. Running out of ideas.

title: Workaround crash due to allocation GC
message:
Workaround crash due to allocation GC

rs.finish() before any GC-like action avoids the finalizerdaemon
crash due to timeout.
